1.text: But I commend to you Phoebe, our sister, who is minister of the assembly which is in Cenchrea;

2.text: that ye may receive her in [the] Lord worthily of saints, and that ye may assist her in whatever matter she has need of you; for she also has been a helper of many, and of myself.

3.text: Salute Prisca and Aquila, my fellow-workmen in Christ Jesus,

4.text: (who for my life staked their own neck; to whom not I only am thankful, but also all the assemblies of the nations,)

5.text: and the assembly at their house. Salute Epaenetus, my beloved, who is [the] first-fruits of Asia for Christ.

6.text: Salute Maria, who laboured much for you.

7.text: Salute Andronicus and Junias, my kinsmen and fellow-captives, who are of note among the apostles; who were also in Christ before me.

8.text: Salute Amplias, my beloved in the Lord.

9.text: Salute Urbanus, our fellow-workman in Christ, and Stachys, my beloved.

10.text: Salute Apelles, approved in Christ. Salute those who belong to Aristobulus.

11.text: Salute Herodion, my kinsman. Salute those who belong to Narcissus, who are in [the] Lord.

12.text: Salute Tryphaena and Tryphosa, who labour in [the] Lord. Salute Persis, the beloved, who has laboured much in [the] Lord.

13.text: Salute Rufus, chosen in [the] Lord; and his mother and mine.

14.text: Salute Asyncritus, Phlegon, Hermes, Patrobas, Hermas, and the brethren with them.

15.text: Salute Philologus, and Julia, Nereus, and his sister, and Olympas, and all the saints with them.

16.text: Salute one another with a holy kiss. All the assemblies of Christ salute you.

17.text: But I beseech you, brethren, to consider those who create divisions and occasions of falling, contrary to the doctrine which ye have learnt, and turn away from them.

18.text: For such serve not our Lord Christ, but their own belly, and by good words and fair speeches deceive the hearts of the unsuspecting.

19.text: For your obedience has reached to all. I rejoice therefore as it regards you; but I wish you to be wise [as] to that which is good, and simple [as] to evil.

20.text: But the God of peace shall bruise Satan under your feet shortly. The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ [be] with you.

21.text: Timotheus, my fellow-workman, and Lucius, and Jason, and Sosipater, my kinsmen, salute you.

22.text: I Tertius, who have written this epistle, salute you in [the] Lord.

23.text: Gaius, my host and of the whole assembly, salutes you. Erastus, the steward of the city, salutes you, and the brother Quartus.

24.text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ [be] with you all. Amen.

25.text: Now to him that is able to establish you, according to my glad tidings and the preaching of Jesus Christ, according to [the] revelation of [the] mystery, as to which silence has been kept in [the] times of the ages,

26.text: but [which] has now been made manifest, and by prophetic scriptures, according to commandment of the eternal God, made known for obedience of faith to all the nationsâ€”

27.text: [the] only wise God, through Jesus Christ, to whom be glory for ever. Amen.
